titleStmt.title: W. J. Gilbert to James F. Robinson
CWG7916

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Washington D, C,
March 19th 1863
His Excellency
James F. Robinson
Governor of Kentucky
Sir

Herewith I have the honor to enclose the recommendation of a number of Senators of the United States and members of the House of Representatives, as also of His Honor the Mayor of this City for my appointment by your Excellency as Commissioner of Deeds &c for the State of Kentucky in this District which apppointment I would hereby most respectfully Solicit

Not being personally acquainted
with Senators or Representatives from all of the States and being desirous of obtaining commissions from all of them, I thought best to forward a general recommendation from my friends in both Houses, rather as members of our National Legislature than as Representatives from particular States

The charge incident to the issuing and transmission of the Commission will be remitted at once upon my being appraised of the amount. Permit me to add that the favor if granted will be most fully appreciated.

I am very Respectfully
Your Excellencies most obedient
Servant -- W. J. Gilbert
-- 17 -- 7th Streets

Dist of Columbia
Comr of Deeds
W. JGilbert
Washiington City
App Mar 23. 1863
